person.persName: John Augustus Williams (Mercer County, KY, educator, Daughters College, curator KY Univ)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, educator and administrator. Kentucky native. Son of Charles Edwin Williams and Arabella Dodge Williams. Married to Mary Louise Hathaway Williams in 1848. Father of Bell Shannon Williams, Augustus Edwin Williams and Bowman Williams. Attended Bacon College in Georgetown, Kentucky, which relocated to Harrodsburg and became Kentucky University. Graduate of Kentucky University. Received LL. D. from Masonic University at LaGrange, Kentucky. Administrator of Prospect Hill Seminary from 1848 to 1850. Founder and teacher at Bourbon Institute and Clay Seminary in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Established Christian College in Columbia, Missouri, in 1851. Returned to Kentucky in 1856 to establish Daughters College with his father from July 25, 1856, to 1893. Owned one enslaved person in Mercer County in 1860. Secretary of the Board of Curators of Kentucky University in 1865.
